LP Model

Solution Methods

The Simplex Method

The matrix way for the simplex method

The easiest way of doing this is to use the matrix representation for the simplex method.

Consider a standard form linear program:

\[\max_{x} c^{T}x\]

subject to:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}Ax=b\\x \geq 0\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

By dividing \(x\) to \(x_{B}\) and \(x_{N}\), the basic and non-basic variables, we have:

\[\max_{x_{B},x_{N}} c_{B}^{T}x_{B} + c_{N}^{T}x_{N}\]

subject to:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}& A_{B}x_{B} + A_{N}x_{N} = b\\& x_{B},x_{N} \geq 0\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

where \(c^{T} = [c_{B}^{T},c_{N}^{T}]\), \(A=[A_{B}, A_{N}]\).

After rearrange the optimization problem, we obtain:

\[\max_{x_{N}} c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}b - (c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}A_{N} - c_{N}^{T})x_{N}\]

subject to:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}& I x_{B}+A_{B}^{-1}A_{N}x_{N} = A_{B}^{-1}b\\& x_{B}, x_{N} \geq 0\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

Let’s ignore the sign constraints and let \(z\) be the objective value. We then have:

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}& z \quad + (c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}A_{N} - c_{N}^{T})x_{N} = c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}b\\& \quad I x_{B}+ \quad A_{B}^{-1}A_{N}x_{N} = A_{B}^{-1}b\end{aligned}\end{align} \]

Therefore, given any valid choice of B and N (the index sets of basic and non-basic variables), we may use the following table to calculate the simplex tableau:

0

\(c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}A_{N} - c_{N}^{T}\)

\(c_{B}^{T}A_{B}^{-1}b\)

\(I\)

\(A_{B}^{-1}A_{N}\)

\(A_{B}^{-1}b\)

basic

non-basic

RHS
